alert.note: Alert for Aiken (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 10:45PM EDT until June 23 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Richmond County in east central Georgia... West Central Aiken County in central South Carolina... * Until 115 AM EDT. * At 1045 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Augusta with multiple road closures and flood waters inundating homes. Between 3 to 6 inches of rain have fallen in the past 3 hours which has led to flash flooding. Additional rainfall is expected over the next few hours as storms continue to move into the area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Augusta, Fort Gordon, Belvedere, Clearwater, Daniel Field, Glendale, Summerville, Midtown, Augusta National Golf Club, Augusta Mall, Village Plaza Shopping Center, South Augusta, Burnettown, Minnick Park, Pendleton King Park, Hillcrest Memorial Park, Kendan Park and Forest Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 21. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 196 and 201. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
